results_summary: HMB supplementation significantly increased appendicular skeletal muscle mass index, mid-arm muscle circumference, and hand grip strength at 12 weeks and 12 months compared to controls, with no reported side effects.
population_specificity: Male liver transplant recipients with sarcopenia (50% prevalence at enrollment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of pulmonary rehabilitation (PR) alone versus PR combined with an HMB-enriched hyperproteic supplement (PRS) on inflammatory and oxidative biomarkers in non-cystic-fibrosis bronchiectasis (NCFB) patients.
results_summary: The PRS group showed reduced neutrophil levels at 6 months, with a significant difference compared to PR alone. The study also noted changes in inflammatory cytokines (IL-6, adiponectin, TNFα) and increased 8-isoprostane levels in both groups, suggesting a pro-oxidative effect of PR and potential benefits of HMB supplementation for neutrophil regulation.
population_specificity: Adults (≤65 years with BMI >18.5 or >65 years with BMI >20) diagnosed with non-cystic-fibrosis bronchiectasis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of combining creatine monohydrate (CrM) and β-hydroxy β-methylbutyrate (HMB) compared to their isolated effects on sports performance, body composition, muscle damage markers, and hormone status.
results_summary: The combination of CrM and HMB showed potential positive effects on strength and anaerobic performance, as well as modest improvements in body composition (increased fat-free mass and decreased fat mass), but no benefits were observed for markers of muscle damage or anabolic-catabolic hormones.
population_specificity: Athletes or individuals involved in sports performance studies (specific demographics not detailed).
effective_dosage: 3-10 g/day of CrM plus 3 g/day of HMB.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of HMB supplementation, alongside protein and other nutrients, on muscle mass preservation, strength, and prevention of sarcopenic obesity in the elderly at risk for type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that HMB, in combination with protein and physical activity, may help preserve muscle mass, improve strength, and prevent age-related muscle loss, though specific results for HMB alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals at risk for type 2 diabetes and sarcopenic obesity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether HMB supplementation during time-restricted feeding (TRF) could enhance resistance training adaptations in resistance-trained females.
results_summary: The study found that HMB supplementation during TRF did not definitively improve outcomes compared to TRF alone, with similar fat-free mass accretion, muscle hypertrophy, and performance improvements observed across all groups. However, TRF with HMB showed a greater reduction in fat mass compared to TRF alone in the per-protocol analysis.
population_specificity: Resistance-trained females

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the acute and residual effects of resistance training and/or HMB supplementation on muscle mass, strength, and physical performance in older women with reduced muscle mass.
results_summary: The study assessed longitudinal changes in muscle mass, strength, and physical performance, but specific results regarding HMB's effects are not detailed in the abstract. The full findings will be presented at academic congresses and published in peer-reviewed journals.
population_specificity: Older women with reduced muscle mass.

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine the effect of HMB on muscle mass, strength, and function in older people with sarcopenia or frailty by reviewing results from available randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: HMB supplementation increased lean body mass and preserved muscle strength and function in older people with sarcopenia or frailty. The review included three RCTs with consistent positive outcomes.
population_specificity: Older people (aged ≥60 years) with sarcopenia or frailty.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 2 or 4 weeks of HMB supplementation could reduce muscle damage after eccentric contractions in untrained men.
results_summary: HMB supplementation (both 2- and 4-week groups) significantly improved MVC torque, ROM, and reduced upper arm circumference and muscle stiffness compared to placebo, with no difference between the two HMB durations.
population_specificity: Untrained men

study_goal: The researchers aimed to outline the role of hematologists in evaluating and managing heavy menstrual bleeding (HMB) in adolescents, including identifying underlying bleeding disorders and addressing iron deficiency.
results_summary: The study highlights the importance of clinical and laboratory evaluation for bleeding disorders in adolescents with HMB, emphasizes the prevalence of iron deficiency, and recommends iron supplementation and hormonal contraceptives as key management strategies.
population_specificity: Adolescents with heavy menstrual bleeding.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate HMB's metabolism, pharmacokinetics, effectiveness in improving muscle mass and strength in older adults, and novel approaches for its use.
results_summary: The review suggests HMB may help protect or rebuild muscle mass in older adults with reduced lean body mass, but limitations like small sample sizes, heterogeneous study designs, and combined supplement use hinder definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Older adults with reduced lean body mass.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of HMB supplementation on recovery following exercise-induced muscle damage by analyzing indirect markers like creatine kinase (CK) and lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) serum levels.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found a significant time-dependent effect of HMB in reducing CK and LDH serum levels, suggesting it may aid muscle damage recovery. The effect was more pronounced for CK than LDH.
population_specificity: Healthy participants

study_goal: The researchers aimed to outline the hematologist's role in evaluating and managing heavy menstrual bleeding (HMB) in adolescents, including identifying underlying bleeding disorders and addressing iron deficiency.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the importance of clinical and laboratory evaluation for bleeding disorders, managing iron deficiency, and providing input on HMB management, particularly for those with hemostatic defects. Combined hormonal contraceptives are recommended as first-line therapy, with adolescent-specific considerations in treatment selection.
population_specificity: Adolescents with heavy menstrual bleeding.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the epidemiology, clinical presentation, diagnostic approach, and treatment options for heavy menstrual bleeding (HMB) in adolescents, particularly focusing on underlying etiologies and management strategies.
results_summary: The study found that HMB is commonly caused by anovulatory cycles due to an immature hypothalamic-pituitary-ovarian axis, with bleeding disorders present in nearly 20% of cases. Combined oral contraceptives and iron supplementation were effective treatments for anovulatory heavy bleeding after excluding other causes.
population_specificity: Adolescents with abnormal uterine bleeding (AUB), particularly those presenting with heavy menstrual bleeding (HMB).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a single dose of HMB-FA supplementation improves muscle recovery after high-intensity exercise.
results_summary: HMB-FA improved work capacity recovery within 24 hours post-exercise, but did not affect muscle swelling, maximal voluntary isometric torque, or countermovement jump recovery compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Trained young males (age ~22.8 ± 3.0 years)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate HMB's metabolism, pharmacokinetics, effectiveness in older diseased populations, and potential novel applications.
results_summary: HMB supplementation improved muscle mass, functionality, and rehabilitation outcomes due to its anabolic and anticatabolic properties. It also showed promise in supporting bone density, cognitive function, and reducing abdominal obesity in older populations.
population_specificity: Older (diseased) adults, athletes, and individuals undergoing rehabilitation or recovery from hospitalization/surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of HMB supplementation on strength and body composition in trained and competitive athletes.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found no significant effect of HMB supplementation on bench press strength, leg press strength, body mass, fat-free mass, or fat mass in trained athletes. All effect sizes were trivial and non-significant.
population_specificity: Trained and competitive athletes (n=193 participants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of HMB-FA supplementation on muscle protein breakdown, cortisol, testosterone, and resting energy expenditure during acute fasting.
results_summary: HMB-FA reduced cortisol levels post-awakening and increased the testosterone-to-cortisol ratio in males during fasting, but did not affect muscle protein breakdown or resting energy expenditure.
population_specificity: Eleven participants (six females, five males)
study_duration: 3-day meat-free diet followed by a 24-hour fast

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of HMB supplementation on physical capacity, body composition, and biochemical parameters in highly-trained combat sports athletes.
results_summary: HMB supplementation increased fat-free mass and was evaluated for its impact on aerobic and anaerobic capacity, body composition, and biochemical markers such as creatine kinase, lactate dehydrogenase, testosterone, cortisol, and lactate.
population_specificity: Highly-trained male combat sports athletes (n=42)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of HMB in enhancing muscle protein synthesis, muscle mass, and strength in elderly subjects, as well as its potential role in managing sarcopenic obesity.
results_summary: HMB supplementation was found to attenuate sarcopenia progression, increase muscle mass and strength in the elderly, with greater effects when combined with exercise. Its role in reducing fat mass and managing sarcopenic obesity remains uncertain due to conflicting results and limited studies.
population_specificity: Healthy or frail elderly subjects, with some focus on sarcopenic obesity.

study_goal: The researchers were examining the anabolic effects of leucine supplementation on muscle protein synthesis and cell signaling.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings regarding HMB's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of HMB in managing sarcopenia, particularly its effects on muscle mass, function, and physical performance in older persons.
results_summary: HMB was found to increase lean muscle mass, improve some muscle function and physical performance parameters in older individuals, and preserve muscle mass during bed rest, though methodological inconsistencies limit definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Older persons with or without sarcopenia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the molecular mechanisms by which HMB supplementation attenuates muscle loss during bed rest and rehabilitation in older adults.
results_summary: HMB supplementation during 10 days of bed rest helped reduce lean mass loss in older adults. The study also examined its effects on muscle mitochondrial dynamics, autophagy, atrophy, and intramyocellular lipids during rehabilitation.
population_specificity: Older adults aged 60-76 years.
study_duration: 10 days of bed rest followed by 8 weeks of resistance training rehabilitation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether oral nutritional supplementation with HMB improves muscle mass and nutritional markers in elderly patients with hip fractures.
results_summary: The study found that HMB supplementation stabilized BMI and appendicular lean mass in the intervention group, while these parameters decreased in the control group. HMB was also associated with increased protein and vitamin D levels and functional improvement.
population_specificity: Elderly patients (aged 65+) with hip fractures admitted to rehabilitation facilities, excluding those with diabetes, low Barthel index scores, or pathological fractures.
effective_dosage: Two bottles a day of HMB (specific dosage not detailed in abstract).
study_duration: Duration not explicitly stated in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the effects of HMB on skeletal muscle and evaluate its potential as a nutritional supplement for improving muscle mass and function in various health and disease conditions.
results_summary: HMB was found to attenuate exercise-induced muscle damage, enhance muscle hypertrophy and strength, improve aerobic performance, and increase resistance to fatigue, particularly in untrained individuals and those under high physical stress. However, its effectiveness was limited in strength-trained athletes and healthy, non-exercising subjects.
population_specificity: Untrained and trained individuals, elderly subjects, and potential applications in muscle-wasting disorders (cachexia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of 11 weeks of HMB supplementation on body mass and performance measures in elite male rugby union players during preseason training.
results_summary: HMB supplementation led to a small increase in body mass compared to placebo, but no significant differences in strength measures. However, HMB appeared detrimental to intermittent running ability (YoYo IR-1 test), though the small sample size due to injuries limits definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Elite male rugby union players (mean age ~20-22 years, body mass ~99-100 kg).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 23 days of HMB supplementation affects circulating levels of IGF-I and IGFBPs in combat soldiers undergoing intense military training.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in IGF-1 or IGFBPs 1-6 levels between HMB and placebo groups, but HMB supplementation significantly lowered IGFBP-7 concentrations, suggesting a potential reduction in stress response.
population_specificity: Male soldiers from an elite infantry unit.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether HMB supplementation could improve muscle mass, physical function, and other co-morbidities in maintenance hemodialysis (MHD) patients.
results_summary: The study found no significant effects of HMB on body composition, bone density, strength, physical function, fall risk, quality of life, or blood parameters, even after excluding noncompliant participants. The results do not support HMB's efficacy for improving co-morbid conditions in MHD patients.
population_specificity: Maintenance hemodialysis (MHD) patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether HMB supplementation affects body composition, aerobic capacity, intramuscular enzyme activity, and hormone levels in trained athletes.
results_summary: HMB supplementation increased fat-free mass, reduced fat mass, and improved aerobic capacity markers (VO2max, time to ventilatory threshold, threshold load, and heart rate). Testosterone levels increased in the HMB group, but cortisol levels rose in both groups, with no significant impact on other blood markers.
population_specificity: 58 highly trained male athletes

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether MaxxTOR® (containing HMB among other ingredients) could enhance lean body mass and strength in resistance-trained males compared to exercise alone.
results_summary: The study found that MaxxTOR® significantly increased lean body mass, leg press strength, and bench press strength compared to placebo, but showed no significant differences in fat mass, thigh muscle mass, or other performance metrics.
population_specificity: Healthy, strength-trained males (ages 22.0 ± 2.5 to 25.6 ± 4.2 years).
effective_dosage: Not specified (abstract does not detail HMB dosage within MaxxTOR®).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a high-protein oral nutritional supplement containing HMB on postdischarge outcomes (readmission and mortality) in malnourished, hospitalized older adults.
results_summary: HP-HMB significantly reduced 90-day mortality compared to placebo (4.8% vs. 9.7%) and improved nutritional status and body weight, but no differences were observed in the primary composite endpoint (readmission or death) or readmission rates alone.
population_specificity: Malnourished (SGA class B or C) adults aged ≥65 hospitalized for congestive heart failure, acute myocardial infarction, pneumonia, or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether HMB supplementation combined with HIIT improves physical working capacity at the onset of neuromuscular fatigue threshold (PWC(FT)) compared to HIIT alone or no intervention.
results_summary: HMB supplementation with HIIT significantly improved PWC(FT) compared to placebo with HIIT and control groups, indicating HMB enhances endurance performance measures when combined with HIIT. No significant differences were found between placebo and control groups, suggesting HIIT alone had limited impact without HMB.
population_specificity: 37 untrained men and women (22 men, 15 women; mean age 22.8 ± 3.4 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current knowledge on HMB's effectiveness in different sports, particularly those with high muscle wear and tear, and clarify its mechanisms.
results_summary: HMB may help reduce muscle catabolism and promote anabolism, especially in untrained individuals undergoing strenuous exercise or trained individuals under high physical stress. It could be beneficial during intense training, competition periods, or injury recovery phases.
population_specificity: Athletes in endurance sports (cycling, athletics), strength-power sports (football, rugby, judo, waterpolo, rowing), and recreational activities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of HMB supplementation on physical capacity, body composition, and biochemical markers in elite male rowers over a 12-week period.
results_summary: HMB supplementation significantly improved aerobic capacity (maximal oxygen uptake, ventilatory threshold) and reduced fat mass, while also increasing peak anaerobic power. However, no differences were observed in anaerobic adaptation or blood marker levels compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Elite male rowers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether HMB supplementation has beneficial effects on muscle loss in older adults.
results_summary: The meta-analysis showed greater muscle mass gain in the HMB intervention groups compared to controls, with no significant changes in fat mass. HMB supplementation may help preserve muscle mass in older adults, particularly in preventing muscle atrophy.
population_specificity: Individuals aged 65 years and older.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of HMB on sarcopenia in older adults, focusing on muscle mass, strength, and function.
results_summary: The abstract suggests HMB may have a beneficial effect on older adults, but larger, well-controlled studies are needed to confirm these findings, particularly in sarcopenic populations.
population_specificity: Older adults (specific age range not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of combining HMB-FA and ATP supplementation on muscle mass, strength, and power in resistance-trained individuals.
results_summary: The study found that HMB-FA and ATP supplementation significantly increased lean body mass (12.7%), strength (23.5%), and power (21.5-23.7%) compared to placebo. Additionally, the combination blunted performance declines during overreaching, allowing continued strength gains.
population_specificity: Resistance-trained individuals

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of HMB on exercise performance, body strength, and muscle injury reduction.
results_summary: HMB was found to increase fat-free mass and reduce exercise-induced muscle injury, though the abstract notes that available data on its efficacy are equivocal.
population_specificity: Athletes and individuals engaged in exercise (not further specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of anemia and iron deficiency on health-related quality of life (HRQoL) in women treated for heavy menstrual bleeding (HMB).
results_summary: The study found that HRQoL improved significantly after treatment of HMB, particularly in anemic women, with notable increases in energy, physical functioning, and social functioning, and reductions in anxiety and depression. Serum ferritin levels took 5 years to normalize, highlighting the need for early iron substitution.
population_specificity: 236 women referred for HMB at five university hospitals in Finland.
study_duration: 12 months (with hemoglobin and ferritin followed for 5 years)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of 12 weeks of HMB-FA supplementation on muscle hypertrophy, body composition, strength, power, and muscle damage in trained individuals, including during an overreaching cycle.
results_summary: HMB-FA significantly increased total strength, vertical jump power, and lean body mass compared to placebo. It also attenuated increases in creatine kinase and cortisol during overreaching, suggesting reduced muscle damage and stress.
population_specificity: Trained individuals

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential role of HMB in improving muscle mass and function in elderly ICU patients, particularly in counteracting ICU-acquired weakness.
results_summary: The abstract suggests HMB has shown efficacy in elderly patients and certain clinical populations for counteracting muscle loss, but it does not provide specific results from the study. The review postulates HMB's potential benefits but lacks detailed findings.
population_specificity: Elderly ICU patients and certain clinical populations at risk for muscle loss.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of HMB-FA, alone or combined with cold water immersion, on CR3 expression and MIP-1β concentration following resistance exercise.
results_summary: HMB-FA significantly elevated the percentage of monocytes expressing CR3 during recovery, while recovery modalities attenuated the rise in CR3 post-exercise. No significant time effect was observed for MIP-1β concentration.
population_specificity: 39 resistance-trained men (aged 22.2 ± 2.5 years).
study_duration: Not explicitly stated (intervention occurred around exercise sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of HMB supplementation in healthy and pathological conditions, including its impact on muscle mass, strength, and exercise performance, as well as its intracellular mechanisms of action.
results_summary: The study found that HMB is effective in preventing exercise-related muscle damage in healthy trained and untrained individuals and in reducing muscle loss during chronic diseases. A dose of 3 g/day was recommended for maintaining or improving muscle mass and function.
population_specificity: Healthy young trained and untrained subjects, elderly subjects, and patients with chronic diseases (e.g., cancer, HIV, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether HMB-FA, alone or combined with cold-water immersion, could attenuate exercise-induced increases in circulating TNF-α and monocyte TNFR1 expression.
results_summary: HMB-FA attenuated the increase in circulating TNF-α immediately post-exercise and reduced TNFR1 expression during recovery compared to placebo and cold-water immersion alone, suggesting it may mitigate the immune response to intense exercise.
population_specificity: 40 resistance-trained men (average age 22.3 ± 2.4 years).
study_duration: Acute intervention (single exercise bout with follow-up at 24 and 48 hours).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the efficacy of HMB supplementation in maintaining muscle mass in elderly and clinical populations, as well as summarize its mechanisms and suggest future research directions.
results_summary: Many studies reported increases in lean mass and strength with HMB supplementation in elderly and clinical populations, though some studies did not find beneficial effects. The review highlights mixed results but suggests potential efficacy.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals and clinical populations (e.g., those with cancer or acquired immunodeficiency syndrome).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of short-term HMB-FA supplementation on muscle damage, protein breakdown, recovery, and hormone status after high-volume resistance training in trained athletes.
results_summary: HMB-FA supplementation significantly reduced muscle damage (lower CK increase) and perceived recovery decline compared to placebo, with a trend toward reduced muscle protein breakdown. No significant changes were observed in testosterone, cortisol, or C-reactive protein levels.
population_specificity: Twenty resistance-trained male athletes.
study_duration: Short-term (exact duration not specified in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the ergogenic effects of HMB, its mechanisms of action, and its safety profile for athletes.
results_summary: HMB supplementation combined with exercise training increases muscle mass and strength, particularly in untrained individuals, with potential aerobic benefits. Recent studies suggest additional mechanisms like reduced apoptosis and enhanced cell survival via MAPK/ERK and PI3K/Akt pathways.
population_specificity: Primarily untrained individuals, with some applicability to athletes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of HMB supplementation on body composition, muscle strength, anaerobic and aerobic capacity, and hormonal/inflammatory markers in elite adolescent volleyball players.
results_summary: HMB significantly increased fat-free mass, knee flexion strength, and anaerobic power but had no effect on aerobic capacity, hormonal levels, or inflammatory mediators.
population_specificity: Elite, national team-level adolescent volleyball players (14 males, 14 females, aged 13.5-18 years, Tanner stage 4-5).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the clinical relevance of HMB supplementation, focusing on its effects on skeletal muscle mass, strength, and mechanisms of cell signaling regulation, particularly in athletes and resistance training contexts.
results_summary: The study found that HMB reduces muscle damage induced by mechanical stimuli and enhances skeletal muscle mass and strength, particularly when combined with resistance training or other sports activities. The review also discusses HMB's role in inhibiting muscle proteolysis and enhancing protein synthesis.
population_specificity: Athletes and individuals engaged in resistance training or other sports.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether HMB supplementation could improve body composition and protein metabolism in bed-ridden elderly nursing home residents receiving tube feeding.
results_summary: HMB supplementation significantly reduced blood urea nitrogen and urinary urea nitrogen excretion, suggesting a reduction in muscle breakdown, though changes in body weight and BMI were not significant between groups.
population_specificity: Bed-ridden elderly nursing home residents receiving tube feeding.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combined HMB and KIC supplementation could reduce exercise-induced muscle damage (EIMD) after eccentric-biased exercise.
results_summary: HMB + KIC supplementation did not significantly attenuate muscle damage markers but showed a trend toward faster recovery in muscle function post-exercise.
population_specificity: 14 untrained male subjects

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether reducing Varroa mite treatments in beekeeping ("innovative method") could foster a stable host-parasite relationship while maintaining honey bee health.
results_summary: Bees managed with the innovative method initially showed lower immune responses and higher DWV-B loads in summer, but these levels normalized by fall, leading to healthy winter bee production and colony survival. The method reduced Varroa mite fall and viral loads over time, suggesting potential for sustainable beekeeping.
population_specificity: Honey bee colonies (Apis mellifera)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the chemotherapeutic activity of Tualang Honey (TH) in an animal model of oral cancer induced by 4NQO.
results_summary: TH significantly reduced the incidence of squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) from 100% to 28.6% at a high dose (2000 mg/kg) and inhibited metastasis of oral cancer to adjacent organs.
population_specificity: Male Sprague-Dawley rats induced for oral cancer using 4NQO.
effective_dosage: 1000 mg/kg and 2000 mg/kg administered for 10 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review honey's antimicrobial potential, particularly against antimicrobial resistance (AMR), and identify key bioactive compounds responsible for its effects.
results_summary: Honey exhibits broad-spectrum antimicrobial activity due to its unique composition, including high sugar content, low pH, and bioactive compounds like hydrogen peroxide and MGO. Specific honey types (e.g., Manuka, Sidr) show varying effectiveness against multidrug-resistant pathogens and biofilm inhibition.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of essential oils and their components on honey bee workers to determine their safety and biochemical impacts as potential biopesticides.
results_summary: The essential oils tested did not cause acute lethal toxicity to honey bees but showed varied biochemical effects, mostly sublethal. Some components inhibited or increased specific enzyme activities, with no significant interactions found when combined with synthetic pesticides.
population_specificity: Honey bee workers (Apis mellifera)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the risks of mad honey toxicity in patients with unexplained cardiovascular symptoms following honey ingestion.
results_summary: The study reported a case of symptomatic hypotension, bradycardia, and gastrointestinal distress due to mad honey consumption, which improved with supportive care. It emphasizes the need for awareness of mad honey toxicity risks.
population_specificity: A 49-year-old woman with a history of HIV and hypothyroidism.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antifungal activity of manuka honey against pathogenic species of the genus Sporothrix, particularly for potential use in treating cutaneous sporotrichosis.
results_summary: Manuka honey showed antifungal activity against Sporothrix species, with varying minimum inhibitory concentrations (5-40%) depending on the species. The antifungal effect was compromised by catalase treatment or filtration, and specific volatile organic compounds and a disaccharide were identified as potential contributors to its activity.
population_specificity: 26 Sporothrix spp. isolates (including Sporothrix brasiliensis, Sporothrix schenckii, and Sporothrix globosa).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Amur linden honey (LH) as a low-glycemic-index dietary intervention for obesity and identify its anti-obesity mechanisms, including the role of polyphenols and gut microbiota modulation.
results_summary: LH demonstrated significant anti-obesity effects in murine models, outperforming equivalent glucose and fructose. The addition of identified polyphenols (PC) enhanced these effects, with LH and HP (LH + PC) modulating gut microbiota, increasing SCFA production, and activating AMPK/PI3K/AKT pathways.
population_specificity: Murine (animal) models

study_goal: The researchers aimed to document a case of wild honey intoxication caused by grayanotoxins and describe its clinical presentation, diagnosis, and management.
results_summary: The study found that consumption of wild honey containing grayanotoxins led to severe symptoms like dizziness, hypotension, and bradycardia, requiring medical intervention with IV fluids, atropine, and monitoring for recovery.
population_specificity: A 52-year-old baker from Chame, Manang, Nepal.
study_duration: Acute exposure (symptoms appeared 30 minutes after consumption).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of a multinutritional supplement containing HMB, amino acids, and carbohydrates on cytokine responses to resistance exercise and training.
results_summary: After 12 weeks, the supplement group showed decreased IFN-γ and IL-10 levels, while IL-1β responses varied by group. Several other cytokines changed over time but did not differ between groups, suggesting HMB and amino acids may modulate some immune responses to exercise.
population_specificity: Healthy, college-aged men

study_goal: The researchers were examining the use of radioactive iodine treatment for pediatric patients with Graves' disease.
results_summary: The study suggests that radioactive iodine treatment is necessary for most pediatric patients with Graves' disease, as spontaneous resolution is rare.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with Graves' disease

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review adverse reactions, risk factors, and treatment protocols associated with iodine-based contrast agents in medical imaging.
results_summary: The study summarized predisposing risk factors, pathophysiological mechanisms, and prophylaxis for adverse reactions to iodine-based contrast agents, along with treatment protocols for severe reactions.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing medical imaging with iodine-based contrast agents.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the associations between thyroid function, thyroid antibodies, and adverse reproductive outcomes, including infertility, miscarriage, and pregnancy complications.
results_summary: The study found that thyroid autoimmunity is a common cause of hypothyroidism in iodine-sufficient areas and that thyroid antibodies are linked to adverse reproductive outcomes like miscarriage and infertility. It also highlighted ongoing debate about screening methods for thyroid dysfunction in pregnancy.
population_specificity: Individuals with subclinical hypothyroidism, particularly those experiencing infertility, miscarriage, or pregnancy complications.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the management of radioactive iodine (RAI)-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) and the role of multidisciplinary approaches, nuclear medicine targeted therapy, and novel molecular agents.
results_summary: The study found that while RAI ablation achieves a high 5-year overall survival rate (97.7%), locoregional recurrence and distant metastases occur in significant proportions, and RAI-refractory DTC has a poor 3-year survival rate (<50%). Multidisciplinary management and novel therapies are improving outcomes for RAI-refractory DTC.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), particularly those with RAI-refractory disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of different Graves' disease treatments (antithyroid drugs, radioactive iodine, and thyroidectomy) on the development or worsening of Graves' ophthalmopathy.
results_summary: Radioactive iodine therapy significantly increased the risk of Graves' ophthalmopathy progression compared to antithyroid drugs, but glucocorticoid prophylaxis effectively prevented worsening, especially in patients with preexisting ophthalmopathy. Total thyroid ablation showed earlier and steadier improvement in ophthalmopathy compared to thyroidectomy alone.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' disease (1773 participants across nine trials).
study_duration: Follow-up periods ranged from 3 to 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the incidence of endophthalmitis using aqueous chlorhexidine for antisepsis before intravitreal injections and review its efficacy and safety in ophthalmic literature.
results_summary: The study found a low endophthalmitis rate (0.0074%) with chlorhexidine, comparable to povidone-iodine, and noted good patient tolerance with only one suspected allergic reaction.
population_specificity: Patients receiving intravitreal injections from 7 retinal specialists across 3 centers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the historical classification of the follicular variant of papillary thyroid carcinoma (FVPTC) and its impact on patient management.
results_summary: The study found that the encapsulated/well-demarcated, noninvasive form of FVPTC, previously classified as cancer, showed almost no recurrence even without aggressive treatment like radioactive iodine therapy. The reclassification to noninvasive follicular thyroid neoplasm with papillary-like nuclear features has reduced unnecessary aggressive treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with encapsulated/well-demarcated, noninvasive FVPTC (approximately 45,000 annually worldwide).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical significance of postsurgery stimulated thyroglobulin (ps-Tg) in papillary thyroid microcarcinoma (PTMC) patients treated with radioactive iodine (RAI) and assess its predictive value for disease persistence.
results_summary: The study found that ps-Tg ≥10 μg/L was the only independent prognostic variable predicting disease persistence in PTMC patients, with an 8-year disease-free survival rate of 76.9%. The ETA risk stratification system was more effective than TNM classification in predicting disease persistence.
population_specificity: 280 PTMC patients who underwent thyroidectomy and RAI treatment, excluding those with excessive anti-Tg antibodies or ultrasound-detected residual disease.
study_duration: Follow-up duration not explicitly stated, but outcomes were assessed over an 8-year period.
